channel.title: Overloading Methods with Javascript

item.title: Overloading Methods with Javascript
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

@silab: Yeah I was definitely going to have a way to recomplie scripts. Either via in-game command, or through an administrative connection. What I mean was is there a more efficient/practical way to implement this same type of behaviour?

@vain: Yeah, I worded it strangely. What I meant was are there any other scripting languages that when compiled perform better than compiled Javascript. Or is the performance difference negligible.

Read full topic

item.title: Overloading Methods with Javascript
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:1, topic:387890”]Okay, so I’m trying to implement a scripting system with my server with Javascript. I’ve read the Rhino documentation, but it kind of jumps around to different places. I just have a few questions.

  1. Is it possible to implement a Java interface with Javascript?
  2. Is it possible to define a method with Javascript? What I mean by this is:
// Concrete class in the server(pseudo code)
public abstract class ItemDefinition {
    // ...
    public abstract ItemBehavior getBehavior();
}
// probably not the right syntax, but I've read you can do something like this
behavior = ItemDefinition.getDefinition(someNotedItemId).getBehavior()
behavior.dropItem() : function {
    // remove item from inventory
    // drop item on ground packet
}
  1. Is there a better way to implement this kind of thing rather than defining the method in the script?
  2. If I were compiling the scripts on start up, is there another scripting language that would be preferred, or is it just person preference?[/quote]
  3. I would definantly have some way to recompile scripts during runtime expessially if I was developing.
    2 AND 1. http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/guides/scripting/programmer_guide/index.html

Read full topic

item.title: Overloading Methods with Javascript

item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

Not sure. I’ll have to check back on this thread since I use javascript aswell.

item.title: Overloading Methods with Javascript
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Okay, so I’m trying to implement a scripting system with my server with Javascript. I’ve read the Rhino documentation, but it kind of jumps around to different places. I just have a few questions.

  1. Is it possible to implement a Java interface with Javascript?
  2. Is it possible to define a method with Javascript? What I mean by this is:
// Concrete class in the server(pseudo code)
public abstract class ItemDefinition {
    // ...
    public abstract ItemBehavior getBehavior();
}
// probably not the right syntax, but I've read you can do something like this
behavior = ItemDefinition.getDefinition(someNotedItemId).getBehavior()
behavior.dropItem() : function {
    // remove item from inventory
    // drop item on ground packet
}
  1. Is there a better way to implement this kind of thing rather than defining the method in the script?
  2. If I were compiling the scripts on start up, is there another scripting language that would be preferred, or is it just person preference?

Read full topic
